Title:  as he shot by them again; at that moment a quick cry went up.  Lashed
Title:  round and round to the fish's back; pinioned in the turns upon turns
Title:  in which, during the past night, the whale had reeled the involutions
Title:  of the lines around him, the half torn body of the Parsee was seen;
Title:  his sable raiment frayed to shreds; his distended eyes turned full
Title:  upon old Ahab.
Title:  
Title:  The harpoon dropped from his hand.
Title:  
Title:  "Befooled, befooled!"--drawing in a long lean breath--"Aye, Parsee!
Title:  I see thee again.--Aye, and thou goest before; and this, THIS then is
Title:  the hearse that thou didst promise.  But I hold thee to the last
Title:  letter of thy word.  Where is the second hearse?  Away, mates, to the
Title:  ship! those boats are useless now; repair them if ye can in time, and
Title:  return to me; if not, Ahab is enough to die--Down, men! the first
Title:  thing that but offers to jump from this boat I stand in, that thing I
Title:  harpoon.  Ye are not other men, but my arms and my legs; and so obey
Title:  me.--Where's the whale? gone down again?"
Title:  
Title:  But he looked too nigh the boat; for as if bent upon escaping with
Title:  the corpse he bore, and as if the particular place of the last
Title:  encounter had been but a stage in his leeward voyage, Moby Dick was
Title:  now again steadily swimming forward; and had almost passed the
Title:  ship,--which thus far had been sailing in the contrary direction to
Title:  him, though for the present her headway had been stopped.  He seemed
Title:  swimming with his utmost velocity, and now only intent upon pursuing
Title:  his own straight path in the sea.
Title:  
Title:  "Oh!  Ahab," cried Starbuck, "not too late is it, even now, the third
Title:  day, to desist.  See!  Moby Dick seeks thee not.  It is thou, thou,
Title:  that madly seekest him!"
Title:  
Title:  Setting sail to the rising wind, the lonely boat was swiftly impelled
Title:  to leeward, by both oars and canvas.  And at last when Ahab was
Title:  sliding by the vessel, so near as plainly to distinguish Starbuck's
Title:  face as he leaned over the rail, he hailed him to turn the vessel
Title:  about, and follow him, not too swiftly, at a judicious interval.
Title:  Glancing upwards, he saw Tashtego, Queequeg, and Daggoo, eagerly
Title:  mounting to the three mast-heads; while the oarsmen were rocking in
Title:  the two staved boats which had but just been hoisted to the side, and
Title:  were busily at work in repairing them.  One after the other, through
Title:  the port-holes, as he sped, he also caught flying glimpses of Stubb
Title:  and Flask, busying themselves on deck among bundles of new irons and
Title:  lances.  As he saw all this; as he heard the hammers in the broken
Title:  boats; far other hammers seemed driving a nail into his heart.  But
Title:  he rallied.  And now marking that the vane or flag was gone from the
Title:  main-mast-head, he shouted to Tashtego, who had just gained that
Title:  perch, to descend again for another flag, and a hammer and nails, and
Title:  so nail it to the mast.
Title:  
Title:  Whether fagged by the three days' running chase, and the resistance
Title:  to his swimming in the knotted hamper he bore; or whether it was some
Title:  latent deceitfulness and malice in him: whichever was true, the White
Title:  Whale's way now began to abate, as it seemed, from the boat so
Title:  rapidly nearing him once more; though indeed the whale's last start
Title:  had not been so long a one as before.  And still as Ahab glided over
Title:  the waves the unpitying sharks accompanied him; and so pertinaciously
Title:  stuck to the boat; and so continually bit at the plying oars, that
Title:  the blades became jagged and crunched, and left small splinters in
Title:  the sea, at almost every dip.
Title:  
Title:  "Heed them not! those teeth but give new rowlocks to your oars.  Pull
Title:  on! 'tis the better rest, the shark's jaw than the yielding water."
Title:  
Title:  "But at every bite, sir, the thin blades grow smaller and smaller!"
Title:  
Title:  "They will last long enough! pull on!--But who can tell"--he
Title:  muttered--"whether these sharks swim to feast on the whale or on
Title:  Ahab?--But pull on!  Aye, all alive, now--we near him.  The helm!
Title:  take the helm! let me pass,"--and so saying two of the oarsmen helped
Title:  him forward to the bows of the still flying boat.
Title:  
Title:  At length as the craft was cast to one side, and ran ranging along
Title:  with the White Whale's flank, he seemed strangely oblivious of its
Title:  advance--as the whale sometimes will--and Ahab was fairly within the
Title:  smoky mountain mist, which, thrown off from the whale's spout, curled
Title:  round his great, Monadnock hump; he was even thus close to him; when,
Title:  with body arched back, and both arms lengthwise high-lifted to the
Title:  poise, he darted his fierce iron, and his far fiercer curse into the
Title:  hated whale.  As both steel and curse sank to the socket, as if
Title:  sucked into a morass, Moby Dick sideways writhed; spasmodically
Title:  rolled his nigh flank against the bow, and, without staving a hole in
Title:  it, so suddenly canted the boat over, that had it not been for the
Title:  elevated part of the gunwale to which he then clung, Ahab would once
Title:  more have been tossed into the sea.  As it was, three of the
Title:  oarsmen--who foreknew not the precise instant of the dart, and were
Title:  therefore unprepared for its effects--these were flung out; but so
Title:  fell, that, in an instant two of them clutched the gunwale again, and
Title:  rising to its level on a combing wave, hurled themselves bodily
Title:  inboard again; the third man helplessly dropping astern, but still
Title:  afloat and swimming.
Title:  
Title:  Almost simultaneously, with a mighty volition of ungraduated,
Title:  instantaneous swiftness, the White Whale darted through the weltering
Title:  sea.  But when Ahab cried out to the steersman to take new turns with
Title:  the line, and hold it so; and commanded the crew to turn round on
Title:  their seats, and tow the boat up to the mark; the moment the
Title:  treacherous line felt that double strain and tug, it snapped in the
Title:  empty air!
Title:  
Title:  "What breaks in me?  Some sinew cracks!--'tis whole again; oars!
Title:  oars!  Burst in upon him!"
Title:  
Title:  Hearing the tremendous rush of the sea-crashing boat, the whale
Title:  wheeled round to present his blank forehead at bay; but in that
Title:  evolution, catching sight of the nearing black hull of the ship;
Title:  seemingly seeing in it the source of all his persecutions; bethinking
Title:  it--it may be--a larger and nobler foe; of a sudden, he bore down
Title:  upon its advancing prow, smiting his jaws amid fiery showers of foam.
Title:  
Title:  Ahab staggered; his hand smote his forehead.  "I grow blind; hands!
Title:  stretch out before me that I may yet grope my way.  Is't night?"
Title:  
Title:  "The whale!  The ship!" cried the cringing oarsmen.
Title:  
Title:  "Oars! oars!  Slope downwards to thy depths, O sea, that ere it be
Title:  for ever too late, Ahab may slide this last, last time upon his
Title:  mark!  I see: the ship! the ship!  Dash on, my men!  Will ye not
Title:  save my ship?"
Title:  
Title:  But as the oarsmen violently forced their boat through the
Title:  sledge-hammering seas, the before whale-smitten bow-ends of two
Title:  planks burst through, and in an instant almost, the temporarily
Title:  disabled boat lay nearly level with the waves; its half-wading,
Title:  splashing crew, trying hard to stop the gap and bale out the pouring
Title:  water.
Title:  
Title:  Meantime, for that one beholding instant, Tashtego's mast-head hammer
Title:  remained suspended in his hand; and the red flag, half-wrapping him
Title:  as with a plaid, then streamed itself straight out from him, as his
Title:  own forward-flowing heart; while Starbuck and Stubb, standing upon
Title:  the bowsprit beneath, caught sight of the down-coming monster just as
Title:  soon as he.
Title:  
Title:  "The whale, the whale!  Up helm, up helm!  Oh, all ye sweet powers of
Title:  air, now hug me close!  Let not Starbuck die, if die he must, in a
Title:  woman's fainting fit.  Up helm, I say--ye fools, the jaw! the jaw!
Title:  Is this the end of all my bursting prayers? all my life-long
Title:  fidelities?  Oh, Ahab, Ahab, lo, thy work.  Steady! helmsman, steady.
Title:  Nay, nay!  Up helm again!  He turns to meet us!  Oh, his
Title:  unappeasable brow drives on towards one, whose duty tells him he
Title:  cannot depart.  My God, stand by me now!"
Title:  
Title:  "Stand not by me, but stand under me, whoever you are that will now
Title:  help Stubb; for Stubb, too, sticks here.  I grin at thee, thou
Title:  grinning whale!  Who ever helped Stubb, or kept Stubb awake, but
Title:  Stubb's own unwinking eye?  And now poor Stubb goes to bed upon a
Title:  mattrass that is all too soft; would it were stuffed with brushwood!
Title:  I grin at thee, thou grinning whale!  Look ye, sun, moon, and stars!
Title:  I call ye assassins of as good a fellow as ever spouted up his ghost.
Title:  For all that, I would yet ring glasses with ye, would ye but hand
Title:  the cup!  Oh, oh! oh, oh! thou grinning whale, but there'll be plenty
Title:  of gulping soon!  Why fly ye not, O Ahab!  For me, off shoes and
Title:  jacket to it; let Stubb die in his drawers!  A most mouldy and over
Title:  salted death, though;--cherries! cherries! cherries!  Oh, Flask, for
Title:  one red cherry ere we die!"
Title:  
Title:  "Cherries?  I only wish that we were where they grow.  Oh, Stubb, I
Title:  hope my poor mother's drawn my part-pay ere this; if not, few coppers
Title:  will now come to her, for the voyage is up."
Title:  
Title:  From the ship's bows, nearly all the seamen now hung inactive;
Title:  hammers, bits of plank, lances, and harpoons, mechanically retained
Title:  in their hands, just as they had darted from their various
Title:  employments; all their enchanted eyes intent upon the whale, which
Title:  from side to side strangely vibrating his predestinating head, sent a
Title:  broad band of overspreading semicircular foam before him as he
Title:  rushed.  Retribution, swift vengeance, eternal malice were in his
Title:  whole aspect, and spite of all that mortal man could do, the solid
Title:  white buttress of his forehead smote the ship's starboard bow, till
Title:  men and timbers reeled.  Some fell flat upon their faces.  Like
Title:  dislodged trucks, the heads of the harpooneers aloft shook on their
Title:  bull-like necks.  Through the breach, they heard the waters pour, as
Title:  mountain torrents down a flume.
Title:  
Title:  "The ship!  The hearse!--the second hearse!" cried Ahab from the
Title:  boat; "its wood could only be American!"
Title:  
Title:  Diving beneath the settling ship, the whale ran quivering along its
Title:  keel; but turning under water, swiftly shot to the surface again, far
Title:  off the other bow, but within a few yards of Ahab's boat, where, for
Title:  a time, he lay quiescent.
Title:  
Title:  "I turn my body from the sun.  What ho, Tashtego! let me hear thy
Title:  hammer.  Oh! ye three unsurrendered spires of mine; thou uncracked
Title:  keel; and only god-bullied hull; thou firm deck, and haughty helm,
Title:  and Pole-pointed prow,--death-glorious ship! must ye then perish,
Title:  and without me?  Am I cut off from the last fond pride of meanest
Title:  shipwrecked captains?  Oh, lonely death on lonely life!  Oh, now I
Title:  feel my topmost greatness lies in my topmost grief.  Ho, ho! from all
Title:  your furthest bounds, pour ye now in, ye bold billows of my whole
Title:  foregone life, and top this one piled comber of my death!  Towards
Title:  thee I roll, thou all-destroying but unconquering whale; to the last
Title:  I grapple with thee; from hell's heart I stab at thee; for hate's
Title:  sake I spit my last breath at thee.  Sink all coffins and all hearses
Title:  to one common pool! and since neither can be mine, let me then tow to
Title:  pieces, while still chasing thee, though tied to thee, thou damned
Title:  whale!  THUS, I give up the spear!"
Title:  
Title:  The harpoon was darted; the stricken whale flew forward; with
Title:  igniting velocity the line ran through the grooves;--ran foul.  Ahab
Title:  stooped to clear it; he did clear it; but the flying turn caught him
Title:  round the neck, and voicelessly as Turkish mutes bowstring their
Title:  victim, he was shot out of the boat, ere the crew knew he was gone.
Title:  Next instant, the heavy eye-splice in the rope's final end flew out
Title:  of the stark-empty tub, knocked down an oarsman, and smiting the sea,
Title:  disappeared in its depths.
Title:  
Title:  For an instant, the tranced boat's crew stood still; then turned.
Title:  "The ship?  Great God, where is the ship?"  Soon they through dim,
Title:  bewildering mediums saw her sidelong fading phantom, as in the
Title:  gaseous Fata Morgana; only the uppermost masts out of water; while
Title:  fixed by infatuation, or fidelity, or fate, to their once lofty
Title:  perches, the pagan harpooneers still maintained their sinking
Title:  lookouts on the sea.  And now, concentric circles seized the lone
Title:  boat itself, and all its crew, and each floating oar, and every
Title:  lance-pole, and spinning, animate and inanimate, all round and round
Title:  in one vortex, carried the smallest chip of the Pequod out of sight.
Title:  
Title:  But as the last whelmings intermixingly poured themselves over the
Title:  sunken head of the Indian at the mainmast, leaving a few inches of
Title:  the erect spar yet visible, together with long streaming yards of the
Title:  flag, which calmly undulated, with ironical coincidings, over the
Title:  destroying billows they almost touched;--at that instant, a red arm
Title:  and a hammer hovered backwardly uplifted in the open air, in the act
Title:  of nailing the flag faster and yet faster to the subsiding spar.  A
Title:  sky-hawk that tauntingly had followed the main-truck downwards from
Title:  its natural home among the stars, pecking at the flag, and
Title:  incommoding Tashtego there; this bird now chanced to intercept its
Title:  broad fluttering wing between the hammer and the wood; and
Title:  simultaneously feeling that etherial thrill, the submerged savage
Title:  beneath, in his death-gasp, kept his hammer frozen there; and so the
Title:  bird of heaven, with archangelic shrieks, and his imperial beak
Title:  thrust upwards, and his whole captive form folded in the flag of
Title:  Ahab, went down with his ship, which, like Satan, would not sink to
Title:  hell till she had dragged a living part of heaven along with her, and
Title:  helmeted herself with it.
Title:  
Title:  Now small fowls flew screaming over the yet yawning gulf; a sullen
Title:  white surf beat against its steep sides; then all collapsed, and the
Title:  great shroud of the sea rolled on as it rolled five thousand years
Title:  ago.
Title:

Title:  
Title:  Epilogue
Title:  
Title:  "AND I ONLY AM ESCAPED ALONE TO TELL THEE"
Title:  Job.
Title:  
Title:  The drama's done.  Why then here does any one step forth?--Because
Title:  one did survive the wreck.
Title:  
Title:  It so chanced, that after the Parsee's disappearance, I was he whom
Title:  the Fates ordained to take the place of Ahab's bowsman, when that
Title:  bowsman assumed the vacant post; the same, who, when on the last day
Title:  the three men were tossed from out of the rocking boat, was dropped
Title:  astern.  So, floating on the margin of the ensuing scene, and in full
Title:  sight of it, when the halfspent suction of the sunk ship reached me,
Title:  I was then, but slowly, drawn towards the closing vortex.  When I
Title:  reached it, it had subsided to a creamy pool.  Round and round, then,
Title:  and ever contracting towards the button-like black bubble at the axis
Title:  of that slowly wheeling circle, like another Ixion I did revolve.
Title:  Till, gaining that vital centre, the black bubble upward burst; and
Title:  now, liberated by reason of its cunning spring, and, owing to its
Title:  great buoyancy, rising with great force, the coffin life-buoy shot
Title:  lengthwise from the sea, fell over, and floated by my side.  Buoyed
Title:  up by that coffin, for almost one whole day and night, I floated on a
Title:  soft and dirgelike main.  The unharming sharks, they glided by as if
Title:  with padlocks on their mouths; the savage sea-hawks sailed with
Title:  sheathed beaks.  On the second day, a sail drew near, nearer, and
Title:  picked me up at last.  It was the devious-cruising Rachel, that in
Title:  her retracing search after her missing children, only found another
Title:  orphan.
Title:
